location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 13/5 'SLAVERY IN THE PERSIAN GULF: JALAL'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 13, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: The volume comprises telegrams, despatches, correspondence, memoranda, and notes relating to slave trafficking in Muscat territory from the Makran coast. The file includes a note (ff 5-6) from the Political Agent, Muscat to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf 'SLAVERY ON THE BATINAH [Al-Bāṭinah] COAST'.The principal correspondents are the Political Agent, Muscat; the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; and the Minister for Foreign Affairs, Muscat and Oman.
